topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0 Beta: Deploying the Lifecycle Manager and Installation Services

body.p: The first phase of the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade installation involves creating a bootstrapping the HP Helion Lifecycle Management virtual machine and installation services.
The installation uses Ansible playbooks, which are files that contain scripts that execute required installation processes.
body.section:
Update the Debain Repository Index File
HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade maintains a local Debian repository on the KVM Host from where Debain packages are installed. Before starting the installation, make sure the Debian files you downloaded in the Prerequisites are present in the repository: Copy the following Debian packages to the /root/cg/dcn directory. When you run the ansible-playbook command, these files will be picked up and moved into the repository.
libprotobuf-c0_0.14-1+b1_amd64.deb
python-setproctitle_1.1.8-1_amd64.deb

section.title: Prepare the system for deployment
section.p: Use the following steps to prepare the server on which the lifecycle manager will be deployed (the KVM Host):

ol.li: Log into the KVM Host using the default credentials

Edit the /root/infra-ansible-playbooks/group_vars/all file for your environment. For information on each variable, refer to the comments in the file with each variable.
The group_vars/all file should appear similar to the following for a KVM + ESX deployment:############################################# Variables for HLM ################################################################# #These variables are relevant in both All Virtual and BareMetal scenarios.
#Set this to 1 if you will not deploy a dcn cloud via this HLM node and will deploy only ovs cloud ovs_cloud_only: 0
#Set this to 'bm' if cloud is being deployed over baremetal. #Set this to 'av' if the cloud is all virtual cloud_type: 'bm'
#These are hlm related variables that must be changed according to your Baremetal Env hlm_login_id: root hlm_password: cghelion
#The following variables are for CLM network IP details for HLM hlm_clmstaticip: 10.x.x.x hlm_clmnetmask: 255.255.255.0 hlm_clmgateway: 10.x.x.x
#The variables starting with cobbler_ are inputs that are usually given to initcobbler.sh. Set accordingly. cobbler_pxestartip: 10.x.x.x cobbler_pxeendip: 10.x.x.x cobbler_pxestaticip: 10.x.x.x cobbler_pxenetmask: 255.255.255.0
#Set the location of your images that will be used by libvirt imagelocation: /var/lib/libvirt/images
#Set the location of your infra-ansible-playbooks ansible_dir: ~/infra-ansible-playbooks
##################################################################################################################################
############################################# Variables for DCN ################################################################## #Set the location of dcn bits on KVM #There must be 4 debs, 2 tar.gz files, 1 vsc qcow2 #You must copy your VSD qcow2 to the imagelocation on the KVM if you want to provision it on the same KVM as the HLM dcn_dir: ~/cg/dcn ##################################################################################################################################
############################################# Variables for VSD ################################################################## #Ignore these variables if VSD is created manually. This section is relevant only for DCN cloud - in both BM and All Virtual cases #These variables are used for VSD Configuration #If you have already configured a VSD and ignore the following variables
dns_domain_name: dcn-one.helion.cg dns_address: 10.x.x.x vsd_address: 10.x.x.x vsd_gateway: 10.x.x.x vsd_netmask: 255.255.255.0 vsd_name: vsd1 vsdimagename: VSD-3.0.0_HP_r3.0_36 upstream_ntp_servers: - 10.x.x.x - 16.x.x.x ###################################################################################################################################
Check the /root/infra-ansible-playbooks/hosts file to enter the IP address of the vibr0 interface in the hlm_kvm_host field, as shown in the following example.

section.title: Deploying the Ironic Patch
section.p: A YML file needs to be added to the /root/infra-ansible-playbooks directory before running the ansible-playbook command. You should have downloaded the processtarball.yml file in the Prerequisites.
Copy the processtarball.yml file to following location on HML host:/root/infra-ansible-playbooks/roles/HLM-CFG/tasks/processtarball.yml

section.title: Deploy the Lifecycle Manager Virtual Machine
section.p: Use the following steps on the KVM Host to deploy the lifecycle manager on the KVM Host using Ansible playbooks.

ol.li:
Execute the following command: ansible-playbook -i hosts setup_hlm_onBM.yml
Sample Ansible Playbook run output

Locate the IP address for the lifecycle manager in the /root/infra-ansible-playbooks/group_vars/all file of the KVM Host under hlm_clmstaticip field. You will use this IP address to SSH into the lifecycle manager VM during the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade installation process.

section.title: Configure Networking for the Baremetal Region
section.p: If you are deploying the baremetal region, perform the following tasks:

ol.li:
Execute the following command to add a BM-CTL route: route add default gw <ip-address> dev <int>
Where <ip-address> is the gateway and <eth> is the Ethernet interface.
For example:route add default gw 192.168.122.1 dev eth0
Make sure that the vNet corresponding to eth0 is part of virbr0 bridge on the KVM Host.
Verify that all iLO ips of the controller blades/DLs are pingable from KVM Host.
